articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: Celtic and Rangers will both benefit financially from Croatia reaching the World Cup semi-final where they will face Argentina.
articles.title: Celtic and Rangers World Cup windfall increases as Croatia reach World Cup semi-final v Argentina

articles.author: Andrew Smith
articles.description: Call it appetite and application ultimately trumping aesthetics and artistry.
articles.title: Celtic's Josip Juranovic stands out as Croatia stun World Cup's great deceivers Brazil to reach semi-finals

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic's Josip Juranovic has been hailed as the "best player" on the field following a strong first-half display for Croatia against Brazil in the World Cup quarter-final.
articles.title: 'Best player' - Celtic's Josip Juranovic hailed by BBC Match of Day team for Croatia v Brazil display

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: When Celtic return to competitive action a week on Saturday with a visit to Pittodrie to face third-place Aberdeen, they will do so in a commanding position. Rangers may have reduced the gap at he top to six points having played Hibs on Thursday but they will be expected to kick on.
articles.title: Celtic transfer latest: Midfielder could exit Parkhead with interest as new World Cup star linked

articles.author: Joel Sked
articles.description: That weird World Cup time is almost over and the quarter-finals are upon us. By the time Brazil and Croatia kick-off the first of four captivating ties over and Friday and Saturday, we’ll have been starved of football at the game's biggest event for 64 hours and six minutes.
articles.title: Qatar World Cup has already ticked plenty boxes - can it now become one of the greats?

articles.author: Angus Wright
articles.description: Celtic have already added two players to Ange Postecoglou's squad ahead of the January transfer window and it could be a busy month in the east end of Glasgow.
articles.title: Celtic transfer latest: Target's hint, Euro giants eye Parkhead star, battle for £4m international playmaker

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Celtic have been heavily linked with a move for South Korea World Cup star Cho Gue-sung and now the player's father has had his say on his next transfer destination.
articles.title: Cho Gue-sung to Celtic: South Korea World Cup star's father has say on transfer destination

articles.author: Matthew Elder
articles.description: Josip Juranovic took time out of Croatia’s celebrations following their World Cup win over Japan to console his Celtic team-mate Daizen Maeda on the pitch.
articles.title: Josip Juranovic reveals what he said to Celtic team-mate Daizen Maeda during emotional World Cup moment

sources.title: Latest imported feed items on ArmchairCelts

articles.description: Former Celtic defender Charlie Mulgrew has discussed his plans to move into coaching when he hangs up his boots. The Dundee United veteran has used the time spent on the sidelines as well as the World Cup break to get his beginnings in the coaching world.Speaking to The Daily Record, Mulgrew spoke of his player-coach role Read More
articles.title: Celtic cult hero Charlie Mulgrew discusses move into coaching

articles.description: No doubt you are like me, and beginning to pine for the “real” football season to begin again. The World Cup is all very well – in fact it has been surprisingly good and surprisingly well organised by our oil-rich friends – but my main concern has been that no Celtic player gets injured, and Read More
articles.title: David Potter’s World Cup Reflections as attention turns to Pittodrie

articles.description: Former Celtic midfielder Roy Keane is a vocal pundit, often quick to make his opinions heard. The Irishman is currently working with ITV covering the World Cup in Qatar but showed what he can do on the park as the team made the most of the days between action.Keane produced a hilarious moment as he Read More
articles.title: Video: Former Celt Roy Keane’s hilarious celebration after goal in Qatar

articles.description: The World Cup in Qatar has attempted to satisfy the lack of Celtic action; however, there is just over a week remaining until the Scottish Champions are back in action. Whilst the return to domestic action will come at Pittodrie against Aberdeen, the Celtic View have shared a picture of Paradise and it’ll certainly have Read More
articles.title: Photo: The stunning photo of Celtic Park that will have you desperate to get back

articles.description: The Celtic media team asked their followers on Twitter earlier today who has been player of the season so far. There has been, as is usually the case with this Celtic team, a mixed response of answers to this question. Some say Reo Hatate, others think Greg Taylor and some say Jota. All these names Read More
articles.title: USMNT official Twitter account’s brilliant reply to Celtic’s favourite player question

articles.description:
The World Cup might still be going on, but we’re fully back in Celtic mode ten days out from the bhoys returning to action. There are four games to be played before the second Glasgow Derby of the season — we’re in no way discounting those games and know Celtic are in for a tough […]
The post Three Possible Glasgow Derby Debuts first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Three Possible Glasgow Derby Debuts

articles.description: Tonight, there’s a story doing the rounds about Mark Guidi saying that Giakoumakis not unhappy with the money on offer in his new deal but that he might be slightly miffed about his status within the Celtic team itself. Could it really be that simple? Guidi has contacts within football, and he might be in […]
articles.title: Is Giakoumakis Unsettled Because He’s Not Celtic’s Starting Striker?

articles.description:
There are a lot of Celtic games coming up thick and fast. The bhoys will be in action a day before the World Cup is wrapped up when they are on Aberdeen at Pittodrie. After that, there’s a quick turnover for a double header at Celtic Park against Livingston then St Johnstone before Christmas. The […]
The post Has Ange Postecoglou Made Hampden Promise? first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Has Ange Postecoglou Made Hampden Promise?

articles.description:
Celtic have been relatively quiet on social media the past few days. They popped up earlier on Wednesday to engage the supporters in some debate about who has been the best player for the Hoops so far this term. The bhoys are on a break due to the World Cup but are due back in […]
The post Official USA Account Responds to Celtic Thread first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Official USA Account Responds to Celtic Thread

articles.description: In his wonderful song “Quite Ugly One Morning” Warren Zevon wrote bitterly that, “From dawn to sundown it’s a long, long way. And it’s a hollow triumph when you make it to the bottom of another day.” He was writing about his personal experiences as an alcoholic, but all of us can recognise a little […]
articles.title: Ibrox Accepts Defeat On Contract Renewals And Braces For A Multi-Million Pound Hit.

articles.description:
Celtic’s training camp out in Portugal could prove to be an important mid-season opportunity for several members of Ange Postecoglou’s squad. With the Bhoys’ return to action later this month edging closer, preparations are beginning to ramp up ahead of the second half of the campaign. In order to make sure his players are ready ...
The post The 3 Celtic stars set for important mid-season opportunity in Portugal appeared first on 67 Hail Hail.
articles.title: The 3 Celtic stars set for important mid-season opportunity in Portugal

articles.description:
DAIZEN MAEDA and Japan exited the World Cup earlier this week after Croatia got the win on penalties in the end. It was Celtic vs Celt when Daizen came up against Josip Juranovic and they both did their countries proud. In the end, Croatia did enough to get through to the quarter final of the […]
The post Latest Post Sums Up Celtic Team Mentality first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Latest Post Sums Up Celtic Team Mentality

articles.description:
Pundit Mark Guidi believes the Giakoumakis rumours doing the rounds during the World Cup are more about his position in the team than about money. News came out last week the Celtic striker could leave in January after contract talks broke down. The reason given at the time was Giak was told his Celtic deal […]
The post Interesting Giakoumakis Claim Emerges first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Interesting Giakoumakis Claim Emerges

articles.description: Just after Gonçalo Ramos had smashed the ball past Yann Sommer for the opening goal in last night’s match between Portugal and Switzerland, the cameras flashed briefly on the face of the man he had replaced in the team. Cristiano Ronaldo, sat on the bench, was not smiling. He looked like someone who had witnessed […]
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Rage Against The Dying Of The Light.

articles.description: Celtic target Cho Gue-Sung is ‘finalising negotiations’ ahead of a potential move to the Scottish Premiership, according to reports in the last 48 hours. The Lowdown: Starring in Qatar The South Korean has recently been in Qatar having been selected to represent Paulo Bento’s former side at the World Cup, and his performances in the […]
articles.title: Last 48 hrs: Celtic target’s agent ‘finalising negotiations’ ahead of mysterious move

articles.description: St Johnstone defender David Wotherspoon has revealed that he spoke to new Celtic signing Ally Johnston about the prospect of a move to Paradise. Wotherspoon, 32, had a spell with Celtic as a youngster but has made his name playing for Hibs and St Johnstone and was part of the Canada National Team out in Read More
articles.title: New Celtic signing spoke to Scottish football veteran prior to move

articles.description: On This Day in Celtic’s illustrious, unbroken history there have been a number of games that have taken place through the years. Some have been great results, others have been gutwrenching – such as the loss on penalties versus Valencia.Thanks to LilZe on Twitter, we are able to travel back in time and revisit games Read More
articles.title: On This Day – relive the Celtic goals, including draw with Guardiola’s Man City

articles.description:
It has been reported that La Liga side Atletico Madrid are planning a scouting trip to the World Cup to watch Celtic defender Josip Juranovic [Football Scotland]. The 27-year-old has been linked to moves away from the Hoops in recent months with Atletico supposedly showing interest in the former Legia Warsaw star during the summer. […]
The post La Liga Giants Make Josip Juranovic Plans first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: La Liga Giants Make Josip Juranovic Plans

articles.description:
Filip Benković has been linked with several moves back to Glasgow since his loan spell at the club four seasons ago, but he is currently applying his trade in Germany. The Croatian international was brought to the club to boost the Hoops defence as he formed partnerships with Dedryck Boyata and Jozo Simunovic at the […]
The post Filip Benković’s Post-Celtic Career first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Filip Benković’s Post-Celtic Career

articles.description: Celtic’s visibility has been noticeable at the 2022 World Cup in Qatar. Whether that be on the pitch or off of it, the Hoops have played their part in this unique tournament.Daizen Maeda had a great World Cup. His talent shone through along with his drive and determination. The Japanese forward cut a maligned figure Read More
articles.title: Celtic’s visibility on and off the pitch in Qatar

articles.description: Kenny Dalglish has spoken out about the recent press and mainstream media coverage over theRangers new manager after sacking Giovanni van Bronckhorst. The Celtic icon has admitted that the Scottish Premiership title is Celtic’s to lose this year and that despite Mick Beale shouting about his squad being as good as Ange Postecoglou’s, the facts Read More
articles.title: Kenny Dalglish: League title is Celtic’s to lose, despite Beale’s shouting

articles.description: Former Celtic manager, Martin O’Neill has astounded Scottish football by claiming he wanted to sign former Rangers captain Barry Ferguson when he was in charge of Aston Villa. The Northern Irishman left Parkhead in 2005 after five glorious seasons in the dugout.In the highest of praise for Ferguson, the ex-Hoops boss claimed that the midfielder Read More
articles.title: Martin O’Neill reveals he wanted to sign old Rangers captain

articles.description: Celtic target Cho Gue-Sung is attracting interest from Europe, according to his representative.  The Lowdown: Red-hot form Having asserted himself as the top scorer in the K-League, Cho has built on this stellar bout of momentum by continuing his goalscoring prominence at the prestigious Qatar World Cup.  22 goal contributions from 31 K-League appearances was […]
articles.title: “It is true…” - Representative confirms interest in 51-goal Celtic target in red-hot form

articles.description:
Former Celtic striker Charlie Nicholas has blasted the return of Peter Lawwell to the club after it was announced that he would succeed Ian Bankier as Chairman. Lawwell was involved with the club for almost 18 years and was a very divisive figure during his reign as Chief Executive. Celtic experience great success but imploded […]
The post Pundit Blasts Peter Lawwell’s ‘Ego’ After Celtic Park Return first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Pundit Blasts Peter Lawwell’s ‘Ego’ After Celtic Park Return

articles.description:
Alistair Johnston signed for Celtic at the weekend. The Canadian signed a five-year deal with the Hoops, moving from MLS side Montreal. The last time Celtic tried to dip into the American/Canadian market under Brendan Rodgers, the plan went horribly wrong. If you remember the names Andrew Gutman and Manny Perez, you’ll probably remember the […]
The post Celtic Dodge Lee Congerton Pitfall with Latest Signing first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Celtic Dodge Lee Congerton Pitfall with Latest Signing

articles.description: My first major article on the madness across the city was written for E-Tims in 2009, when I was writing under the pen-name Che Timvara. I will always be grateful to their team for giving me that opportunity. The most important article I wrote for them, and maybe the most important I have written or […]
articles.title: It’s Now Clear This Ibrox Club Is In Dire Straits. Celtic Must Stick The Hose In Their Mouth.

articles.description:
Celtic forward Daizen Maeda has taken to social media after his World Cup heroics for Japan [@M_daizen_1020]. 初めてのW杯。これまで出会った方々、所属したチーム、家族、ファン、サポーター、沢山のサポートがあったからこそこの舞台に立てました。四年後。必ずリベンジします。沢山の応援本当にありがとうございました。これからも宜しくお願いします。#FIFAWorldCup pic.twitter.com/2PIxgE4GXU — 前田 大然 Daizen Maeda (@M_daizen_1020) December 6, 2022 The 25-year-old was a regular starter for his national team at the tournament and scored the opening goal in their Last 16 tie against Croatia.  His message […]
The post Daizen Maeda Shares World Cup Social Media Message first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Daizen Maeda Shares World Cup Social Media Message

articles.description: Former Celtic star Charlie Nicholas is concerned at what is happening at Celtic, believing the stall on new deals for key players could impact the future of Ange Postecoglou.  The Lowdown: Big players, little returns Amidst the current debacle on the contract front for key players like Josip Juranovic and Giorgos Giakoumakis, Nicholas feels both […]
articles.title: Charlie Nicholas alarmed by what he's hearing from Celtic, could force Ange to do a Rodgers

articles.description: Today, one of the worst kept secrets in Ibrox was confirmed to their fans; the era of directors funding the club out of their own pockets by trading cold hard cash for increasingly worthless shares is at an end. The next time a director puts his hand in his pockets to fund the mad fantasises […]
articles.title: An Ibrox Director Has Confirmed Their Fans Worst Fear About Continued Funding.

articles.description: The Mooch got a standing ovation today at the Ibrox AGM. He should have gotten two; one from the floor and the other from the board. He fulfilled his primary role quite brilliantly at that meeting; he gave the fans something to cheer and the board an easy ride. I’ll go into some detail for […]
articles.title: The Ibrox Board Gets An Easy Ride As “Stormy” AGM Turns Into A Love In For The Mooch.

articles.description: Celtic Historian David Potter each morning on The Celtic Star looks back at key Celtic events and matches on this day starting on 6th December 1890. David’s latest bestseller The Celtic Rising ~ 1965 The Year Jock Stein Changed Everything has SOLD OUT on Celtic Star Books but you can still pick up a copy Read More
articles.title: Celtic On This Day – 6th December – David Potter’s Celtic Diary

articles.description:
Josip Juranovic took to social media on Monday evening to declare he was proud of his Celtic teammate Daizen Maeda after their head to head at the World Cup. It was Daizen’s goal that put Croatia and Josip on the brink of elongation from the World Cup before. Second half equaliser took the last 16 […]
The post ‘Proud of you’ – Josip Juranovic Sends Heartfelt Message to Daizen Maeda first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: ‘Proud of you’ – Josip Juranovic Sends Heartfelt Message to Daizen Maeda

articles.description: As the Celtic women welcomed Dundee United to the Excelsior Stadium, it was Fran Alonso’s ladies who came out on top with an amazing seven goal thriller.
articles.title: Dominant display in Airdrie: Celtic 7:0 Dundee United

articles.description: The Ghirls beat The Tangerines 7-0 at the Excelsior Stadium in their penultimate match before the winter break.
articles.title: Celtic hit Dundee United for Magnificent 7

articles.description: After his goal today it wasn’t just the Celtic supporters that were delighted with Daizen Maeda. The small, yet explosive attacker has garnered the praise of many a pundit and deservedly so. His displays at this current World Cup in the Middle East has been nothing short of awesome.Never one to give up, as is Read More
articles.title: “He was really, really good today”, Jermaine Jenas on ‘unselfish’ Daizen Maeda

articles.description: Celtic have acted on their interest for Al-Ahly midfielder Mohamed Magdy, according to an update shared by Sky Sports journalist Anthony Joseph.  The Lowdown: On the map Better known as ‘Afsha’, Magdy has endured a gradual rise to prominence, having proved himself at ENPPI and Pyramids FC before his move to Egyptian giants Al-Ahly. Last […]
articles.title: Talks held: Sky Sports reporter shares latest on Celtic's pursuit of 20-cap dynamo

articles.description:
Details have been released about Celtic’s friendly against French side Rennes with the game scheduled for December, 10 at 10am Celtic Park time [Rennes].  After extending their lead at the top of the SPFL Premiership to nine points, Celtic travelled to Australia to take on Sydney FC and Everton in Ange Postecoglou’s homecoming before getting […]
The post Celtic Friendly Details Revealed first appeared on Celts Are Here.
articles.title: Celtic Friendly Details Revealed

articles.description: A Bond villain once remarked to 007 that he re-appeared “with the tedious inevitability of an unloved season”.  I suspect that more than a few Celtic supporters felt the same at the news of Peter Lawwell’s return to the Celtic boardroom,   When he announced that he was leaving, many of us wondered if it […]
articles.title: A TALE OF THE NOT SO UNEXPECTED

articles.description: In spite of the hype in the papers, Ibrox’s board faces an uncomfortable morning tomorrow but not a threatening one. They will get some stick and they’ll be asked some hard questions but they are going to get through it unscathed. There are questions they should be asked but won’t be. Much of the heat […]
articles.title: The Ibrox AGM Is Tomorrow. Smarter Fans Would Have That Board Over The Coals.
